parsed.internal_thinking:
I have analyzed the board following Alice and Bob's initial placements. Alice has taken Node 20 (12 pips: W11, B6, S8) and Bob has taken Node 42 (12 pips: Wh9, O5, Wh9). My goal is to find high-yield nodes that provide a balanced resource spread. 

Node 12 is currently the highest-pip node available with 11 pips, covering Wood 3 (2 pips), Brick 6 (5 pips), and Sheep 5 (4 pips). This is an excellent expansion spot. For my second settlement, I plan to target Node 25, which offers Wheat 8 (5 pips), Sheep 4 (3 pips), and Ore 3 (2 pips) for a total of 10 pips. This combination will give me access to all five resources with a combined 21-pip production, which is a very strong and balanced start. 

Since I am the third player in a 3-player game, I will be placing both of my settlements and roads back-to-back in the 'snake' draft order (Alice-Bob-Charlie-Charlie-Bob-Alice). I'll start by placing my first settlement on Node 12. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: I am planning to take Node 12 first and Node 25 second. This gives me a full resource spread (Wood, Brick, Sheep, Wheat, Ore) with 21 total pips. I should place my road from Node 12 toward Node 11 or 13 to expand toward the coast or the center, and from Node 25 toward Node 24 to keep expansion options open.
parsed.say_outloud: Alice, Bob, those are some really strong starts! I've been looking at the board, and I think I'll go for Node 12. It gives me a nice mix of expansion materials, and I'm hoping that 6-Brick treats me as well as it treats you, Alice! Good luck everyone!
